main event: On September 6, 1957, an unidentified aerial object was observed for about 3 seconds in North Truro, Massachusetts.
interesting points: The object followed a flame and angled down before disappearing, resembling a meteor's flame extinguishing., The observer noted that the object had a constant brilliant white color and appeared to have an aura around it., The sighting lasted for only 3 seconds, making it very brief., The observer was convinced that the object did not resemble any known aircraft., The conclusion suggested that it might have been a balloon or a meteor.
witness description: observer on ground, no further personal details provided
